div.l: Som esement has lawe / I shapen be
For Iohn ther is a lawe / that says thus
That yf a man / in oo poynt be greuyd
That in a nothir / he shalbe relevyd
Our corne is stolyn̄ / sothly it is no nay
And we han had / an ille fytt to day
And syn y sal haue / noon a mendement
A geyn my los / y wol haue esement
Bi goddis sowle / it sal non othir be
This Iohn answerd / aleyn̄ avyse the
This myller is / a pereilous man he seide
And yf that he / out of his sleep abreyde
He myht don vs both a velonye
Aleyn answerde / I coıı̄unte hym nat a flye
And vp he ryst / and bi the wenche he crept
This wenche lay / vpryht and slept
Tyl he so nyh was or she myht aspye
That it hadde be to late / for to crye
And shortly for to sey / they were at oon
Now pley Aleyn̄ / for y wol speke of Iohn
This Iohn lyth stylle a forlong wey or too
And to him self / maketh rewth and woo
Allas ꝙquod he / this is a wykked Iape
Now may y sey that y ys but an ape
Yit hath my felawe / somwhat / for his harme
He hath the mylleris douhter / in his arme
He auntred him / and hath his needis spede
And y ly as a draff sakke / in my bedde
And whan this Iape / is tolde a nothir day
I shall be holde a daffe a cokenay
